definition: to store/to save/to have in reserve/heir/Taiwan pr. [chu2]
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

pinyin: hua4 xue2 wu3 qi4 chu3 bei4

definition: US Federal Reserve (Fed), the US central bank
pinyin: Mei3 guo2 Lian2 bang1 Chu3 bei4

sentences.english: So how can we not be concerned about the reserves during the transition period?
sentences.chinese: 过渡时期我们不过问储备金行吗？

sentences.english: When fractional-reserve banks expand credit, malinvestments result.
sentences.chinese: 当部分储备银行扩张信贷是，不正当的投资产生了。

sentences.english: Don't even think about the trillion-plus dollars in foreign exchange reserves.
sentences.chinese: 甚至不要再想那一万亿以上的外汇储备了。

sentences.english: Our production brigade has set aside ample reserve grain.
sentences.chinese: 生产大队留出了充足的储备粮。

sentences.english: Make certain that all their gold remains here with us. Their stores of food as well.
sentences.chinese: 确保他们的金子都在我们手上，还有储备的食物。

sentences.english: There should be other reserve currencies .
sentences.chinese: 应该有其它的储备货币。

sentences.english: Women head investment banking operations at Kotak Mahindra and JPMorgan Chase and the equities division of Icici. Half of the deputy governors at the Reserve Bank of India are women.
sentences.chinese: 印度储备银行半数以上的副理事都是由女性担任。

sentences.english: The bank says it keeps plenty of liquid reserves against the dread day.
sentences.chinese: 银行声称他保有大量流动储备以应对恐惧日的到来。

sentences.english: Urgently allocating and transporting central medical reserve to support quake-hit areas.
sentences.chinese: 一是紧急调运中央医药储备支援灾区。

sentences.english: The move comes at a time when the dollar's long-standing role as a reserve currency is under threat.
sentences.chinese: 此行动发生在作为长期储备货币的美元面临威胁之时。

sentences.english: The bet is that holding yuan-denominated assets is an important feature of a diversified national reserve.
sentences.chinese: 持有人民币资产是国家储备多样化的重要特征。

sentences.english: Schools should promote hand hygiene and respiratory etiquette and be stocked with appropriate supplies.
sentences.chinese: 学校应提倡手部卫生和咳嗽礼仪并适当储备相关物资。

sentences.english: The significance of the huge foreign-exchange reserves lies elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 巨额外汇储备的重大意义在于其它方面。

sentences.english: The Fed is the focal point for domestic US funds movement.
sentences.chinese: 联邦储备系统是美国国内资金转移的汇集点。

sentences.english: Colleges are a reservoir of talents for companies.
sentences.chinese: 大学是公司的人才储备库。

sentences.english: This reserve is earning "a pittance," he says. "But we sleep well."
sentences.chinese: 他说，这笔储备赚钱很少，但保证“我们睡的安稳”。

definition: to stock up/to lay in supplies/to hoard (for speculation)/to corner the market in sth
to furnish/to provide/supply (as in supply and demand)
to be deficient in sth/to be short of sth (supplies, money etc)
